intro: Bilabrella martialis, commonly known as the red bilabrella, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean region. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its striking red flowers with two prominent lips, giving it its scientific name. It typically grows in coastal areas and thrives in sandy soils. Due to its ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens, though it is primarily found in the wild.
